CatDescriptText: Ophelia Jones, Schenley Heights and Edward Schreiber, trucker, Allegheny, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think is the major cause (or causes) of the increase in juvenile delinquency?" Ophelia Jones' answer reads: "There's a need for more adult supervision in the homes and outside the homes."  Edward Schreiber's answer reads: "I think that there's a lack of parental care."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ophelia Jones wearing dark eyelet blouse and beaded necklace, standing in front of Brass Rail Restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Edward Schreiber wearing plaid short sleeve button down collared shirt, standing in front of open driver's side door of car
